Reviews.Title: “Centrally located tidy sleeping place”
Reviews.Author: nanduus
Reviews.Content: Hotel is not for the fainthearted ones, steep stairs which will drain the energy if you are carrying heavy luggage. But the rooms are tidy, clean and good collection of furniture (typically small room/small bed but that is in line with other hotels in the country). Good breakfast, nice and friendly staff. The location is perfect, not too far from the central railway station (15mins walk) and very close to the Anne Frank museum. Red light district and other window shopping shops are sort of 10mins walking distance which is not a bad thing if you want a quiet sleeping place. Overall I liked the place and would recommend the place to couples, families or professionals. There were few stag and hen party teams, but very civilised ones :)

Reviews.Title: “Better than 'average' but not quite 'very good'”
Reviews.Author: lacornuta
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights - its located in a great area of Amsterdam, within easy walking distance to Centraal which is handy. Breakfast wasn't great - just toast, tea and coffee and hard boiled eggs. Liked: location, wasn't too small for one, safe deposit box and free internet Disliked: LONG NARROW STAIRS very hard for baggage!

Reviews.Title: “No changes day by day”
Reviews.Author: grisuccio
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in an optimal location, 5 minutes maximum on foot from Dam square. The staff is very kind, but the reason for the negative review is that my room was not cleaned during the day: no new towels, no new pillow, no new bed sheet, dust everywhere....the cleaning in one hotel is the basis rule, but not here!Further,stairs are very very steep, to carry one medium luggage up to the superior floors is a titanic action!

Reviews.Title: “not bad - steep stairs”
Reviews.Author: Admin44 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was worried about this Hotel after reading some very negative reviews but I thought it was fine. Firstly there are some very steep stairs and there's no lift so if you're not fit you may find them difficult, my single room was small but clean and had a decent size bathroom, it also had a small balcony with a nice view of the surrounding streets and canals. There was some street noise at night, staff were helpful, I asked for directions and an extra pillow both were provided without a problem. The Hotel has a nice sunny breakfast room with a resident cat, the breakfast was basic, cereals, tea/coffee, toast, eggs, cheese, the food was tasty and there's plenty of it. The location is good, under 10 minutes walk to Dam Square. I walked to Centraal Station on the day of my departure, took under 15 minutes. I wouldn't recommend this Hotel if you're looking for a romantic quiet weekend or if you have mobility problems but if you're a single traveler, a young person or on a lad's weekend I would, good location, basic but clean, decent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Dam”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Big advantage is that the hotel is 3 mins from Dam. Room was tiny, but in acceptable condition with clean bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “take your own toilet rolls”
Reviews.Author: avril296
Reviews.Content: no toilet roll in bathroom, shower hanging off the wall, basic to say the least but the staff were courteous. we would not reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - decent b&b”
Reviews.Author: Jas1982_12
Reviews.Content: Got a bit worried when I read one or two of reviews - especially one from 6th March below. But have to say that we didnt want much as we were not planning on going to Amsterdam to spend the weekend in the hotel! It had clean beds and a clean bathroom....a group of lads don't need much else - 12 of us were out for most of day...and night! So spending loads on a lovely hotel was pointless! Would return if on a weekend with the lads .... probably wouldnt bring the missus though :)

Reviews.Title: “Worst place ever,sewage works would have smelt nicer”
Reviews.Author: Tom11095
Reviews.Content: Well i dont know where to start,there were just so many bad things about this dump! First of all we arrived there saturday morning where we was greeted by a nice young lady who told us our rooms were upstairs (yet again another 500 steps) where we found our double room. At first glance it didnt look that bad until younopened the bathroom door to be greated by a sewage smell,just going for a wee you had to peg your nose unless you was used to bathing in sewage. Went downstairs to the girl on reception only to be fobbed off with the pathetic excuse that the drains were made up! This then followed the blue brothers who came up to try make our room smell fresher in which my 2 year old nephew could have done better. All we got was an air freshener in ehich we could use incase the smelt came back but little did they know that the smell was so putried that it never went away at all. Once this gastly situation had slightly got better only by the use of a hanky over your nose we thought we would take a look round the room only to find out the window wouldnt lock so we had to sleep in sub artic conditions all night with the possibilities of someone coming through the window and robbing us. We then couldnt think our ideal could get any worse but then the bathroom had no propper ceiling, you could view the sky from our bathroom,maybe this reduced radiation from the smell? Dare i say anymore to entise you to this run down mess? One word of advice,dont go there unless you want to become used to the smell of sewage, fear of someone getting in, sleeping in artic conditions or having a gym exercise getting to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Jesseyes
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I visited for 1 night 12th February and I was not looking forward to it after reading the reviews on here. I was however more than happy with the hotel, the loction was perfect less than 5 minuttes from Dam Square. The staff were very helpful, we got there early from the ferry and we were able to check in straight away. They gave us a map pf the area and helped us to get our barings in a city that is all too easy to get lost in. The room was clean and tidy, house keeping were very helpful when we needed anything. The breakfast was basic and self service but was fresh and was a good start to the day, the breakfast room was spotless. Ok so the hotel is a little run down but this just adds to the character. There are indeed 37 steps up to reception but these are typical of the area. I would most certainly stay here again, the views are amazing and you couldn't ask for a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Antigua26
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the Di Ann hotel in September 2011. I found it on Trip Advisor and reviews for it were average, not so wonderful but i took a chance anyways as it was in our budget and it was in a good location. The hotel itself isn't bad, the staff were friendly and the hotel seemed pretty clean too. Yes the stairs are very steep but it didnt bother us as were only staying two nights and we hardly had any luggage. My only complaint was our room. It was very run down. The bathroom was also a little special; the only thing that seperated the shower from the rest of the bathroom was what looked a kids shower curtain so everything got wet and the bathroom flower semi flooded. The TV also didnt work either, but it didnt really bother us. The room also had a musty smell, but again, we didnt spend much time in the room so it didnt bother us. The onky we did like about our room was the view, we just sat by the windows and enjoyed people watching. I think we would stay there again, as the loaction was good (right round the corner from the Anne Frank House & Jordaan neighborhood). I thinks it good if your not looking to spend much time in your room and plan on seeing Amsterdam all day. I also think it wasn't worth what we paid but oh well.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Liz_D27
Reviews.Content: Hotel Di-Ann is good value for money. The staff were friendly and all spoke good English. We paid 75 Euros a night, including breakfast; the room had it's own bathroom, and a fridge - for this price only 1.2kms from Amsterdam Centraal you can't complain. A tip for those who travel with lots of luggage, don't stay here, the staircase is long, narrow and windy (typically Dutch!) and that's just to reception not your room!

Reviews.Title: “Love/Hate”
Reviews.Author: McCready82
Reviews.Content: I love the views from the balcony. I love watching the traffic go by and the crazy cyclists rushing around, there is something really nice about being in an oasis of calm while there is mayhem on the streets below. The room however was terrible. It stank of rotting meat, there was no TV and the leg had fallen off my bed. The mattress was also bigger than the base so I fell out the bed if I rolled too far to one side. I was weighing up how bad the room was and how nice the balcony is, I might even go back there and sleep on the balcony next time.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I ever stayed in - Di-Ann, Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: PiersAllen
Reviews.Content: I climbed up the hotel double-height staircase with heavy case - steep as a ladder with narrow treads - to find the hotel cat playing with a live mouse in reception. When I pointed this out to the receptionist, his co-hort chased and crushed the mouse with a metal waste bin - and showed me the result. It got worse....My room was a small as a cupboard, the bed not made properly, badly lit and stuffy, the ceiling dirty-broken polystyrene tiles, the TV only switched on and off by putting the plug in and out; the bathroom was dirty - basin, tiles, loo pan - and it stank to high heaven of old urine. I was unable to change rooms as the "hotel"(a misnomer if ever there was one...) was full. I was unable to use the bathroom apart from a quick pee: even the plughole stank of urine and cleaning my teeth made me retch. On the second day the bed was not made at all and I assume no-one even came into the room. Breakfast was very mediocre: cornflakes were available but no sugar to put on them; the queue for the ancient toaster went across the room; plastic meat and cheese looked completely unappetising. The coffee was undrinkable... What else? Well - the location is great and I guess that is the sole reason the place survives. But please - don't even think of going there...

Reviews.Title: “Just Awful”
Reviews.Author: Cybearz
Reviews.Content: This is a dreadful place.. easily the worst I have ever stayed in. The welcome was sour faced but the room itself was just awful... it was cramped, dingy, noisy and dirty. There were no facilities except a loud little fridge and housekeeping was non-existant. I had the misfortune of staying 4 nights in the place during which time never trusted eating there. The location wasn't bad if you could ignore the noise of the trams outside. I would never, ever stay there again or recommend it anyone.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER EVER STAY HERE!!”
Reviews.Author: pfuzzibear
Reviews.Content: We booked this Hotel for 4 nights due to the location just off Dam square. We have visited Amsterdam several times before and always stayed in the Leidsplein area, which is the best place to be, but decided on this trip to try some where else for a change. What a mistake!! We booked through booking.com who highly recommended the hotel Di-Ann, this turned out to be a total mis-representation. When we arrived at the hotel we had to climb 75 steps to get to reception and a further flight to get to our room. We had a very sour greeting from the receptionist who came across as totally disinterested,took our payment and handed us a key to our room. When we opened the door we were totally dismayed as the room was filthy dirty and so small we couldn't even open our luggage, further more, there were no towels or soap in the bathroom. I went down and asked if we could see another room and was told by the receptionist there was no point as they were all the same. The hygiene is a BIG problem in this hotel. We stayed four nights but the bed wasn't made once and no clean towels were supplied. When we complained they threw a couple of towels on the bed and the rubbish bin was still full and the bed unmade. We had paid for breakfast but didn't risk nor want to eat there because of the filthy atmosphere. This hotel is easily the worst we have ever stayed in, I would not recommend it to anyone and I would not put a dog in it.

Reviews.Title: “ignore the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: scooty17
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 202 for 1 night, this hotel very central good for a base, yes rooms are small and could do with a good clean but clean enough bedding fresh and clean funny thing was kepted finding teaspoons in very strange places me and my husbands had a great laugh, balcony fantastic to watch the world go by. Girl on reception very helpful but seemed a bit stressed and breakfast plentyful but only 2 star you people that have given bad reviews your nuts what do you expect if you want 4 star then book 4 star. Amsterdem on a whole mad place and watch out for bikes and mopeds need eyes in back of head. One more thing stairs into hotel are steep but not that bad just be careful coming down
