Reviews.Title: “The worst, terrible & dishonest hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lolocoke
Reviews.Content: The room is extremely small. Once you go in, you cannot open your luggage. More, the hygiene is a big problem. We stayed here five nights but only two times housekeeping. And the last time was requested by us. They just changed towels and the rubbish bin was still full. When we reported to the host who said he cannot check all rooms whetherâ€™s clean or not. We thought he was so irresponsible! The most Important is that this hotel is dishonest. We paid by cash when we check out. But the hotel recharged my friend credit card again. And we still cannot get the money back . It is terrible hotel we never seen. Never and ever stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OMG”
Reviews.Author: bigrobwozencroft
Reviews.Content: Mate all you lot thst complain rearly nred to experiance life theres nothing wrong with it staff nice tick location good tick cleanleness tick your all soft if you even think of bad reviews to wright and the stairs hahahaha unless your coming in pissed every time maybe there hard if not shut up in fact i cheked in pissed and still fine top place top hotel

Reviews.Title: “don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: vicandy
Reviews.Content: We always read reviews with an open mind but this time we wished we had paid heed! yes the stairs are steep but that was by far the least of our concerns firstly a warm welcome does certainly not await and then a further 2 flights of stairs to room that you wouldn't keep a dog in. It was smelly and filthy with no towels'single sheets on a double bed and dodgy electrics! One member of staff could certainly do with a course in customer services. Breakfast limited and bearable if you can stand the cat on your table finishing what you can't! I most certainly would NEVER recommend this hotel to anyone and will be paying more heed to reviews.

Reviews.Title: “basic”
Reviews.Author: goody16
Reviews.Content: the rooms are very basic but comfortable .small things would greatly improve this hotel like clean curtains ,a mirror in the room(the only one was in the bathroom ) and a lick of paint ,the room was quite small and the noise from the traffic below made it impossible to get a full nights sleep .on the plus side the bathroom area was adequate and the free safe in the rooms are a good idea and the views and location are great .the staff were pleasent enough and the breakfast was basic but acceptable(toast,ceareal,preserves ,yogurts )but please move the cat .not everyones a fan of felines .also please note that the stairs are very steep and would be difficult to climb for some people even just to the reception area

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Peak District National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Great for what we wanted!!”
Reviews.Author: vjcc80
Reviews.Content: This was our second time here, we stayed 6nts (last time was just 1 nt). Its a cheap 2 star hotel in a brilliant location..... 5 mins walk from Centraal Station 5 Mins walk to Red Light District 1 Min walk to Jordaan (Anne Franks House) 10 Mins walk to leidseplien and Vondel Park 2 Min walk to Dam Square. 1 Min walk to nearest Coffeeshop (Rockland or Greay Area) Based on price and location I would stay here again and again. The place is just average. Clean and red themed deco for the rooms. Crisp white sheets on the bed and seemed to be changed every day. The bathroom was adequate although had a wierd smell (pickled onion monster munch). We had a balcony room which was perfect as we had great views of the canal. Helpful staff on reception. Stairs are steep but they didnt bother me and I am a largish lady so the fitties out there shouldnt have a prob either. We had 2 massive suitcases and the stairs were no probs!!!

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in a great location - good staff etc”
Reviews.Author: jvangurp
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Diann with a companion in early June. The room was small but perfect for our needs. It's and older building with lots of steep stairs but for any average person it really is not an issue whatsoever. I can see that someone very large or elderly or in bad shape for some reason might not like the stairs but for most people no problem. The staff was excellent! Very helpful and professional. The room was clean and tidy. It was at the back and was almost silent all night and even in the morning. I was astounded how quiet it was. Breakfast is standard fare. I recommend getting there a few minutes before 8am and you will avoid the 'rush' for things as it's a tiny bit crowded at the breakfast buffet counter. I recommend this hotel for budget conscious travelers looking for a good location in the amazing city of Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the average young tourist”
Reviews.Author: amore555
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend have just returned, and after having read the reviews on this site, were pleasantly surprised with this hotel. I would put a lot of the complaints down to snobbery to be honest, you get what you pay for. It's a low price, and some receptionists are more helpful than others (one in particular made me wait for my room key while she was on the phone) There is a cat, but it wont bother you if you leave it alone. The rooms are very small, but when used as a base from which to explore the city this is no problem. Breakfast is basic but sufficient, and always clean and freshly restocked. The cleaners are a bit overzealous, if you plan on having a lie in (after a night at the coffee shops) expect to be woken up by the cleaner repeatedly tapping on your door until you go and address him. Overall I would stay in this hotel again, it is perfect for young tourists who want a base right in the middle of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: EllyN22
Reviews.Content: A bunch of us stayed here for two nights in May and it was honestly the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. It's more like a hostel but lacking the common facilities and community that a hostel provides. I don't even know where to begin......the stairs are crazily steep as though they are trying to forewarn you about what's to come! The staff who were friendly during our stay, were confused- changing their minds about when we should pay, who should pay and whether or not weâ€™d need to all change rooms or perhaps even move in to share rooms! There were a couple of unfriendly staff, once there were 4 of us standing waiting for our rooms keys and we had to wait for 10 minutes with the receptionist talking on the phone and refusing to look up at us. Eventually I had to go behind the counter and get our keys myself. My room, which was a double on the 3rd floor was dated, dark and to make it worse, only one light worked so I couldnâ€™t even see into the cupboard when it was fully light outside. There were electrical wires sticking out of an uncovered plug socked and several other sockets didnâ€™t work. The pillows and blanket were old and lumpy and smelled like stale cigarette smoke, but I did have curtains, which is more than one of the people I was travelling with had in her single room on the 4th floor. There was no toilet paper in the bathroom, no soap and there were bug on the floor on my second day. Two of us got bitten by something while we were there. Breakfast was minimum- some bread, cheese, condiments, juice and coffee, with the cat patrolling for scraps! I did recount all of this to one of the nicer people on reception when we left and she just looked embarrassed and admitted that things needed to improve. I suppose if you were travelling on a tight budget and just needed a roof over your head then you might find this a good fit, but you couldnâ€™t pay ME to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “flea-ridden. no lights. disintergrating.”
Reviews.Author: cate1984
Reviews.Content: hugely over-priced for a tumbledown wreck of an excuse for a hotel. majority of structure/funishings seemed to be taped together. no working lights in the room. staff displayed total ineptness and incompetence in the task of changing a light bulb. woke up with numerous suspicious insect bites...

Reviews.Title: “city central, value for money, polite staff, cute cat”
Reviews.Author: mandylewty
Reviews.Content: we had read a lot of bad reviews of the di ann, but were surprised, yes the stairs are bad but this is a canal side property and nothing an able bodied person could not cope with. the rooms were basic, clean and small, we used the hotel as a base , breakfast , then day out, back to freshen up, then out for the night. the location was excellent really near to dam square. breakfast basic but cereal , toast , eggs ,jam, coffee etc, not bad at all, if you want a central base like we did and are not looking for 4 star this hotel fits the bill, the staff were willing to give you help and advice, a fantastic four days was had by all

Reviews.Title: “Don't!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: fruity bee
Reviews.Content: I was part of a group of nine adults away on a dutch dash to celebrate a friends birthday! The ionly reason we booked in at the hotel was because in had a central location. We knew about the stairs in advance but didn't realise how bad they were!!!!!! The hotel was very basic, very cramp, very smoky smelly, won't go back!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for..”
Reviews.Author: rebeccatakacs57
Reviews.Content: After originally booking for Hotel Neutraal and seeing the reviews for that I quickly found another hotel and this was one of the cheapest. I read some reviews and as always, didn't get my hopes up. First things first, the stairs into the hotel are dire (but what do you expect for canal houses) so I wouldn't recommend for disabled or those hard of walking. The young girl who was on reception spoke English well and explained to us about the rooms, check in and out times, breakfast times etc. She even printed us a map out off Google maps when we asked her for directions! Check in isn't allowed till 2pm but they have a small room to leave luggage in. We went to our room and there were two single beds, a table with two chairs, a television (with BBC 1!), a fridge, a wardrobe (with hangers), a safety deposit box and an en-suite bathroom. If you want a kettle or hairdryer, ask at reception and they will give you them free of charge. If you are going to be staying in your room for most of your trip, book somewhere else, but for somewhere to crash at night time and freshen up in it is perfect. The continental breakfast was fine, two types of cereal, white and brown bread, different flavoured jams and nutella, tea, coffee, orange juice, and cheese slices. This hotel is perfect if you are looking for somewhere central to stay at a cheap price. All in all, a good trip and would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “it is not worth Â£50 per person, try the novo hotel”
Reviews.Author: percyp33
Reviews.Content: it is the only hotel i have ever stopped in where you were told to clear your own breakfast table ! obviously not run by its owners, the staff seemed lackadaisical, our room was small, but clean. if the cat had come into our room we couldn't have swung it !! never again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: lisa30231
Reviews.Content: Firstly, I feel I was mis-sold this hotel. This is not the fault of the hotel but I was told it had a 'few stairs' and was 2 minutes from the train station. It is actually more like 15 minutes and has a lot of stairs. I took quiet a large suitcase with me and struggled with it both up and down the stairs. The hotel staff were polite but, like previously mentioned, a little unhelpful. We got to the room and it had a very strange smell to it and also wasn't clean. There was mildew on the shower curtain and general dirt all over the bathroom and bedroom. The room was very cramped and one bed was pushed up against the window which was rotting and wouldn't close properly so the room was freezing. The bathroom flooded when using the shower as previously mentioned and there was no towel or shower mat provided. No tea and coffee facilities were available in the room and when we enquired about this I was advised to wait until breakfast the next day. Breakfast left a lot to be desired also. A loaf of bread, some cornflakes and cheese which looked like it had been sat out far too long. There was no service here at all we just got pointed into the dining room by the reception staff. Half way through breakfast we ended up with a cat sat in the middle of the table, although I like cats, I find this a bit unhygenic. It's a shame as this could be a lovely hotel but I am struggling to find anything positive to say about it. The only good point was the fridge available in the room. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER THINK ABOUT STAYING IN THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: mac1Pontefract
Reviews.Content: i have worked all over europe central and eastern and have never stayed in a hotel as bad as this. The rooms are dirty cramped and they smell. .We had booked a double room but were given a small single that had a double bed sqeezed into it .The toilet was broken and the smell was disgusting.They changed this for us but the second room was nearly as bad .When we went for breakfast the food was unwraped and there was a cat wandering about the breakfast room very unhygenic We were told there were steps up to the check in these are very steep about 40 of them but were not told about all the others to get to the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely basic hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Fatyak
Reviews.Content: After finishing up a weeks worth of back packing I was ready for a couple of quiet nights in when I arrived at this hotel. As with previous reviews, yes the stairs are steep, but this is characteristic of all old Amsterdam buildings. I was checked in quickly and easily by a friendly girl on reception and to my delight I discovered my room had a small balcony which looked out over the street and canal. It was lovely to sit and read and enjoy a glass of wine as the sun went down in the evenings. The room was clean and had a little fridge which was excellent for keeping food and drinks cold (and probably a sensible idea to use as you do get mice running around old buildings in Amsterdam, although I never saw one here). Breakfast was basic but inclusive so this was fine. It is true that the bathroom floor floods a little when you use the shower, but not enough for it to cause a problem. The room was small and a little dated, but having the balcony made a huge difference. All in all a great location and not a bad price considering this.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!”
Reviews.Author: willp63
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend have just returned from our 3 night stay in amsterdam at the di ann hotel and i thought id add my review to the website. I read alot of the reviews on here before we left and we were not really expecting much and we were right, it was truly awful, the stairs leading up to reception were not bad, what you'd expect really in an old dutch building. As for the rooms they were pretty bad to be honest, very small and smelly. We had a double room on the side of the hotel facing the canal, which was lovely but the windows were rotting and would not stay open. The whole decor of the room was just horrible dated and dirty. The bathroom was discusting there was no shower basin so when you used the the shower water would fill the bathroom and if you were not quick enough the water was out under the door and into our room. The shower curtain had obviously been brokeen before we arrived and it looks like the staff decided a peice of fishing wire attached to the ceiling would fix it!! And the smell of you not what was constantly lingering in the bathroom. We also had no tea or coffee facilities as stated on the website, When i quereed this at reception i was told to use hot water from the tap!!! seriously??? later on in the evening i asked again and this time was given a kettle coffee and milk with no questions asked. Generally the hotel is in a perfect location its just a shame its so poorly run and the staff at the reception desk were rude and un-helpful and the rooms were just a joke, And for 300euros for 3 nights is wrong for a hotel of this standard, Travelodges in england are far far better than this hotel and they have bigger, cleaner rooms and friendly staff. The breakfasts were ok just your basic toast,cereal tea and coffee. On a whole our trip to amsterdam was awesome, such an amazing city and such lovely welcoming people Just one more thing please think twice before booking here because i wish i did!! thanks for reading

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very comfortable - but watch out for those stairs!”
Reviews.Author: gaia-IRL
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Amsterdam quite early in the day, and expected to have to leave our luggage at the hotel until we could checkin. However, we were able to check in right away! Our room was ready, and although quite small and perhaps not the most modern decor, it was very comfortable, with a fantastic shower. There was a TV and even a small refrigerator too, so we were able to make packed lunches for our days exploring Amsterdam. The location was excellent, we walked from Centraal station with our luggage, it only took 15 minutes, and it's only 5 minutes from Dam square. Breakfast however wasn't very exciting, coffee, juice, bread, meats and cheeses, not the best quality, but not the worst either, just a little bland. The breakfast room however was beautiful, with balconies so we could breakfast with a view of the canals and the Palace on Dam square! While the hotel was perfect for us with just a little luggage, the stairs are very steep and narrow, and if we had anything bigger than our rucksack and cabin-sized baggage we would have had trouble with these stairs. There is no elevator, but the staff are willing to help bring luggage up and down the stairs.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Perfect location but a bit shabby”
Reviews.Author: jen6668
Reviews.Content: Last minute booking at the travel agents but good price, even if only sleeping there. Not many good reviews in Amsterdam so we expected the worse, being 2*. Very basic room but clean sheets! Lovely people at reception desk. Breakfast adequate but not of good quality. The location makes up for the negative side. It's perfect for the sites and trams are good to get further afield. The staircase will be scary for those who live on flat land, but being a Yorkshire lass everything is up a hill for me, so you may have to stop to catch your breath a couple of times. The historic buildings are beautiful, the Anne Frank House is a little walk away, (go early) There are restaurants cafes take-aways, plenty of choice for eating all nearby. The bonus for the Di Ann is that there is a fridge in the room, other than that it's like sleeping in an office storeroom...but it doesn't matter if you are asleep. So if like me you don't need the 'full Engish, sausage and all breakfast', and are just going for the culture and architecture and beauty of Amsterdam you will be fine.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireKebab
Reviews.Content: paid â‚¬200 for two nights in a double room with breakfast for a weekend away with my husband .first the steps to reception are a death trap . Reception and staff great and good location . The room i would compare it with a Â£20 a night b&b in blackpool . The bedding and bathroom was clean , the fridge stank and was warm and full of water . The chairs on the balcony look like they had been donated from a skip , breakfast was boiled egg toast cheese and coffee tea or juice . Would,nt stay there again . We pay less to stay in a devere hotel with 5* quality .

Reviews.Title: “this is a hotel to avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: macinross
Reviews.Content: just retured from a long weekend in this hotel with my partner and sister. it is my 10th visit to amsterdam and i have stayed in many different hotels ranging from 2-4* but i have to say this is bad bad bad and i am not a complaining type usually make the most of a bad situation. the stairs are steep which i expected having read the reviews so prepared but still very tricky 1st night having booked two rooms were told would have to share as hotel over booked a bit awkward as room tiny and no privacy for my poor sister the 3 bedded room was grotty with burn holes in the duvet and filthy curtains, smelly bathroom and heavily stained carpet moved to double and single room same shabby state and so small moving around with just two people was a challange. there was no remote for the telly and no plug in the room for my hair dryer. the small fridge was right next to the bed doubling up as a bed side table turning on and off all night the worse thing was waking up with the sound of rustling to discover a mouse in my suitcase! had been there long enough to make 3 holes in the lining and had eaten a packet of crisps i had in the front pocket. this was last night after i had packed ready to return home couldn't sleep as kept hearing noises all night - unforgivable please avoid

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain in a great part of town”
Reviews.Author: JESSinSD
Reviews.Content: OK. It's a budget hotel so If your looking for the Crown Plaza, this is NOT the place. The stairs are the most difficult thing about The Hotel Di Ann and they are not for the weak. Otherwise, it is a great deal for the money. They provided everything we needed. The rooms are tiny and old, but the beds were comfortable, clean and warm. The bathrooms were decent and clean. The breakfast (Included with the room price) was adequate. They have a nice balcony/patio that looks over the street that is a nice place to chill. They have a nice cafe right below the hotel and many shops which will help in making your stay convenient. Euro for Euro, this was a great deal and it was everything I expected.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Peak District National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Di Ann !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: vjcc80
Reviews.Content: I have been to Amsterdam 7 times and have stayed 3* 4* and 5*, this was my first time 2*, we had a low budget for this trip. I was pleasantly surprized with this hotel. There are steep stairs but they didnt phase me. Check is was easy with friendly staff allocating us to our room. We booked a double, the room is small and cosy. Clean. There is a fridge which we found very useful. The breakfast room is lovely, all dark wood and a nice choice of continental breakfast. Location is fantastic, less than 5 mins walk to Dam Square, there is a coffeeshop just accross the road too which was good!!!! Id stay here again and would reccomend to friends. Cheap n Cheerful!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not As Bad As People Say”
Reviews.Author: pheelinphunki
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely fine. Yeah ok, there are some quite scary stairs, but its all part of the fun. If you dont like or cant handle stairs, stay some where else. Location is fantastic, 3 min walk from Dam Square. Rooms are tiny, but at the end of the day, it was somewhere to put your head. When your in the city of Amsterdam, your hardly in it anyhow! Would definately stay here again due to cost and location and would recommend to anyone (Who can climb stairs that is)

Reviews.Title: “dangerous stairs”
Reviews.Author: daisylisburn
Reviews.Content: Have just returned last night from a 2 night trip staying in this hotel. Like most of the reviews it is very small, no lift, basic rooms, though at least were clean, but a little worn in places. No toiletries or tea and coffee facilities in the room, though did get them eventually on request. Worst of all were the steep and very dangerous stairs leading to the reception area, then more steep stairs to the other 2 floors. Not recommended for anyone over 40 years of age, or have breathing problems. Thankfully once we went out we stayed out until bedtime as the stairs were a big problem.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Di-Ann is a decent low-priced hotel close to everything”
Reviews.Author: KimberlyG2007
Reviews.Content: I only spent one night at the Hotel Di-Ann. It's very close to the Red Light District and within walking distance of lots of attractions. The hotel is a decent place to stay if you are just looking for somewhere to sleep and not spend time in the room. Rooms are small but very clean. The staff is very courteous and helpful and they serve a nice breakfast in the morning. No luxury room here but you get what you pay for, and this room was incredibly inexpensive for Amsterdam centre. The only true downside I found with this hotel is the very steep steps, but this is typical of old Amsterdam buildings (pictures attached). I had to walk four flights of these very steep and narrow steps to my room. The steps were not a problem for me, but I would not recommend this hotel for someone who is handicapped or will find walking all these steps a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and helpful staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: nilad299
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a 2 star hotel the stairs are step but that is what you expect to have in amsterdam. Booked in was twin room and informed them i had booked a double with travel agents and when they checked it said twin on there form but they where more than helpful and changed us very very quickly. Helpful at giving you information about the area and city and where to go and places to eat. Breakfast was good. Only 2 min walk to Dam Square and great to get about. The room was small but what do you expect when it's 2 stars but had everything you need a safe, fridge, tv and bathroom. Will be back to this hotel very soon loved the staff and location.

Reviews.Title: “More than good enough”
Reviews.Author: Megaphobema
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great value for the money. I had a single deluxe on the 2nd floor with a private balcony and a view of the canal / street leading to Dam Square. The room was small but it had everything including a bathroom. Things could have been a little cleaner but nothing was bad enough to complain about. Breakfast was very simple but good in the morning. Staff was very nice and helpfull with any questions. The stairs were not as bad as people make them sound. People complain about this place like they were expecting a 5* hotel when its not. For the money I paid for 5 nights and the amenities that come with it this was a great deal. Not many hotels have a private bathroom, balcony, breakfast and great location for this price. Would recommend this hotel as it doesn't deserve some of the poor reviews from the past.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location. Good value. Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: scots_weekenders
Reviews.Content: Yes, the stairs are steep. But what do you expect in a traditional canal side Amsterdam house? We had a lovely room on the 2nd floor with a canal view. Small, but with all facilities, including tea and coffee in the room and a good sized fridge, with none of the expensive mini bar features! We stayed 4 nights, so tea and coffee facilities were free, otherwise 6 euros. Location was perfoect to explore Amsterdam on foot or by canal and the city was beutiful, helped of course by perfect weather.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jenna4
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine for travellers who wish to explore the city, not hang out at the hotel. It is located a 10 minute walk from the centre of town and is a short walk to the Dam and Anne Frank's. The rooms are sufficient but small. They room was clean enough as was the washroom. They serve a basic breakfast of toast, tea and cereal. For those with mobility concerns this is not the hotel for you as there are about 50 steep stairs to climb just to get to the reception area. It is inconvenient but typical of the buildings in Amsterdam. The staff can be helpful and the restaurant just outside has great food. Definitely 'no frills' accomodation but will do for those that aren't too picky.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Di-Ann - bit of a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: BELLA89
Reviews.Content: Hotel website was no good for booking the hotel, it does not take your payment, you have to pay in person at the hotel when you leave. But it is there to reserve a room. Remember that. The hotel had pubic hairs on the toilet seat and fridge door! Not pleasant. The stairs are very steep and illegal in size and they last forever and there is no lift so take a small case. The bed sheets were clean as was most of the room besides stray hairs from a previous visitor. The rooms are very boring and small and have not been decorated for decades. The breakfast is just basic toast, coffee, tea, cereal, yogurts, fresh juice. There is a computer in this room for internet access which was good. The hotel is right near Dam Square so location could not be better. The staff were not very helpful or friendly. You can smoke in non smoking rooms. Overall I thought it would be a nightmare when I arrived, but I got used to the place, although I would not choosed to stay there again, I would look for an alternative. I guess thats what you expect from a 2 star.

Reviews.Title: “One to avoid - the Di-Ann in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: EGGs60
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel online through 'easytobook' as it is centrally located. We went for a deluxe double room at â‚¬150 a night initially and â‚¬110 thereafter; we only stayed one night of three booked and wouldn't have done that if we'd been able to find alternative accommodation sooner. A very steep flight of about 70 stairs leads to a pokey reception area. The room had a balcony and (just) a canal view but it was about 8 feet square and there was barely room to move. The wardrobe had two hangers, one broken with nails sticking out; the loo didn't flush properly and the tv remote was broken. We made comparisons with other hotels for prices and the Di-Ann is a major rip-off. I was happy to pay for the second night (unused) just to get out of there. Sheets and towels were at least clean, but prices were higher than nearby 3-star hotels and only very close behind the 4-star American Hotel. Raadhuisstraat is a miserable street and contains many similar hotels, so avoid them!

Reviews.Title: “Good value central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Montyspaw
Reviews.Content: We did a long week-end in Amsterdam and thought this hotel was great. Yes the rooms are small but what do you expect in a typical Amsterdam building, which all tend to be tall and narrow? The beds were comfortable and clean, as was the rest of the room. We had a problem with the key card but the staff came up straight away to help us out. We found the staff in general very polite and helpful and they let us leave our luggage there on the last day. Breakfast was more than adequate. We really enjoyed our stay here and would be more than happy to stay again. It's also in a great location, really close to Dam Square and a lot of the main sights.

Reviews.Title: “Worst of the worst”
Reviews.Author: princess0310
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Di-Ann for three nights in September. It's too bad that places like this can remain in business and ruin the reputation of a wonderful city like Amsterdam. The room was extremely small, the safe didn't work, the breakfast was unfit for human consumption...we both became ill... and the staff was rude and dishonest. To make things worse, they pretended their credit card maching was not working and demanded cash at checkout. Don't fall for this scam. This dive is the worst place in Amsterdam and probably all of Europe.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Rosexoc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for an inexpensive room that was centrally located. We got it. The hotel has a fantastic location. Sure, the stairs are steep, but that's common. What was worse was the staff and our room. The staff wasn't helpful and could hardly understand English. Our room was small, which was fine, but it wasn't very clean or well maintained. The room was on the street, which was very noisy. The weather was quite warm when we were there, but we had to close the window at night because of the noise. Also, the refrigerator didn't work. The breakfast was ok, nothing special. For the money you could probably find something better, but the location is tough to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Quick visit”
Reviews.Author: OntarioTravel3
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful staff. Had a small problem with the safe in the room and they sent someone immediately to look after it. Small room and long, narrow stair-case, winding at the top. We had the second floor so we did it twice. TOn our canal cruise, they explained why most of the buildings have staircases like this. It is because of land space and population density. So it appears that you will encounter this in most buildings/hotels. Blankets were a bit old and had a couple small holes in them. Breakfast was great. Lots to choose from to eat and drink. We were able to leave our luggage at the front desk after we checked out in order to walk around for a few hours. Directions to hotel from Amsterdam Centraal Stn: Walk out of station, keep right, cross the canal and continue walking straight. until you get to Raadhuisstraat. You will recognize this street by the long "phalic-like symbol" on the left side of the street, there are steps on the bottom where people sit and relax...also lots of pigeons. Mak a right on Raadhuisstraat toward the Magna Plaza, then make a quick left and a quick right, cross the canal and the hotel is on the left.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced but decent hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Trintravel
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Amsterdam on a Saturday without a hotel reservation. One of the few affordable hotels we were able to get was the Di Ann. We needed a room for five people. Di Ann had a quad room available but they could fit a matress on the floor. The matress didnÂ´t really fit but it worked. There was a smell of weed in some of the hallways, but then it is Amsterdam after all.. We paid 220 EuroÂ´s for our room. The only justification for that price could be the central location. Bathroom was tiny. I am 1.90 m and I could not sit straight on the toilet, but it was clean. Breakfast was included in the price. If you are disabled or have difficulty walking you need to know that this hotel has no elevator and very steep stairs. I would stay here again, but only because of its location.

Reviews.Title: “Love love LOVE the Di Ann”
Reviews.Author: Tangerine81
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 7th-10th March with my boyfriend and it was fantastic. Its not 5 star luxury but it did exactly what it said on the tin. Linen and towels were changed everyday, the reception staff were lovely and sooo helpful (especially with directing us to the late night convenience store one night!). They even looked fter luggage while we killed time before going to the airport. The cat was cute but didnt really see much of it! Ok, breakfast is the same every day but WHO CARES! I love toast and cereal so was good enough for me! one thing i will say was they need another toaster! But if you get to breakfast early enough...... it so happened our room was right next door so we were always there quite promptly. The location of the hotel is perfect and for the money we paid we couldnt have asked for more. Its in the middle of everywhere and boy did we walk everywhere!! The stairs would not be suitable for those of limited mobility (although there were quite a few older ladies staying there at the same time and they seemed to manage ok) if anything though it keeps you fit. there is a delightful pancake cafe downstairs and to the immediate right and also to the right after walking for 10-15 mins there is a late night convenience store (as beforementioned this was told to us by the night reception guy) handy for one more bottle of wine! We did sooo much but there was still sooo much more we didnt have time for so are definitely going back later this year. And yes we will definitely be staying at the Di Ann.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Di Ann is awful”
Reviews.Author: OccasionalTravellers
Reviews.Content: From the picture it looked perfect. The location is brilliant some of the staff were very friendly and the cat is lovely. We were so looking forward to seeing Amsterdam but the minute we walked into our room our hearts sank. It was tired, dark, dingy and dirty. If I had not seen a sign saying no guests I would have said it was a very low class knocking shop. We slept in our clothes ontop of the bed as the sheets were marked and showered in our socks so as not to come into contact with the floor. We stayed out as late as we could to spend as little time in the room as possible. Breakfast was as tired as the room but we had to eat it to give us the energy to stay out!! In some respects it did spoil our trip as it was the first time we had been away for 4 years but Amsterdam is lovely I would deffinately go again but never to that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: rebma_can
Reviews.Content: When I arrived, I opened the door to the hotel to see stairs! Lots of stairs! Not so bad when you reach the reception desk. Nadia, working at the front desk was wonderful. She was helpful with directions, and suggestions. They also had a guy available to help me take my bags up more stairs to my room. My room was clean, and had a nice balcony to enjoy the beautiful street/canal view. The bathroom was ok, when I showered, the whole bathroom floor was soaked, as there was nothing stopping the water from running everywhere. But they give you 2 towels, so one was used to dry the floor. The water was always hot, and had great pressure! The location of the hotel was good. 2 blocks to dam square, which has lots of shopping, and you can find a grocery store right there too. The hotel has a small fridge in the room if you wanted to buy a few things. Breakfast was good, white and brown toast, jam, peanut butter, nutella, honey, instant coffee, tea, orange juice, and cheese. I think there was a choice of cereal and milk too. Enough to choose from, to get you going in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap room in a central location”
Reviews.Author: Tim&AlanCornwall
Reviews.Content: The best feature of the Di-Ann has to be its central location. We thought it might be noisy but we didn't have any problems at all. I wonder whether rooms at the front would hear the passing traffic but most of the accommodation is well above street level. There is a huge steep staircase from the street to reception and at least one further staircase to get to the rooms. They are small and a little tired but ours was very clean. We choose the hotel as we were travelling with a single person and the single room supplements were very reasonable. Breakfast is self service. There's not much of a selection but we weren't paying big bucks so we didn't mind. The hotel is a stone's throw from Dam Square and at the end of an evening it was nice to know that our room was only a few steps away. A centrally located hotel that's ok for a stay of 2 or 3 nights but I wouldn't want any longer there. For a first trip to Amsterdam I would suggest paying just a little more and getting a room in one of the town house hotels that line the canals.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, small rooms, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: km9165
Reviews.Content: We stayed here our first night in The Netherlands. Our luggage was lost en route so the stairs were not as intimidating. Room was tiny, and maybe not super-clean, but we had a nice balcony. The staff were very helpful in assisting us contact the airlines about the luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Amsterdam, Hotel not great”
Reviews.Author: LadyC1983
Reviews.Content: Booked flights to Amsterdam for New year 2006-2007 and we were struggling to find budget accomodation for our dates since going over new year, so a friend recommended this hotel and warned us that it wasnt the best! When we arrived I was very disappointed with the rooms. Very shabby and small and one of the plug points was hanging off the wall! The hotel is about 10 minutes walk from Dam Sq and a few mins walk from the Anne-Frank Museum. We didnt see that many other people staying in the hotel. Although the location was good, I wouldnt recommend this hotel and would advise to look elsewhere, maybe last minute.com or expedia. Breakfast was not good at all and we didnt bother to go after the first night! beware - very steep stairs!

Reviews.Title: “Never again, but not so bad ...”
Reviews.Author: Emmyx2
Reviews.Content: The stairs are narrower, steeper and higher than you can imagine, unless you are a Mayan archaeologist. The breakfast is as described by others - give it no weight in your decision as you will eat elsewhere if you are hungry. The staff was very nice, very helpful and knowledgeable. The location is perfect - virtually everything is in walking distance, the tram stops nearby. The room was clean, but stained in places. (there is a difference) The WC cramped, but functional, great pressure and plenty of hot water. Beds - meh. Same for the towels. If you are trying to be cheap, stay here. If $50/night more is not a big deal, you will find better value elsewhere. BTW: nice cat, s/he does add character.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms”
Reviews.Author: manchoy
Reviews.Content: I can only confirm what other reviewers have said- steeep stairs, small room, the friendly cat that joined me for a coffee in the breakfast room, sweaty cheese and a toaster that only works on one side- you get what you pay for. But what do you have for breakfast back home? There's toast, cheese, boiled eggs, jams, honey, peanut butter, chocolate spread, orange juice, coffee, cornflakes & milk, all you can eat. The room did smell of tobacco, so I opened the window for a few hours. There was heating in the room, and it worked o.k. The reception staff were helpful, and pointed me in the direction of the Albert Hein supermarket on the next block when I discovered I hadn't packed a toothbrush (cheap beer-Leffe Triple @ 1.1 euros!). You can get bigger rooms and a better breakfast, but at a cost- try the Botel or the Rho. However, as a solo traveller I always get the smallest crappiest rooms, so I may as well go cheap and have done with (more cash left for other stuff...). Get up earlier, have a smaller breakfast, then stop for 'elevenses' and enjoy a coffee and some of Amsterdam's excelent cakes- try the apple cake at one of the 'Hot and Cold' chain cafe's. I paid about Â£546 for 7nts b&b, flights from Exeter, & travel insurance (about Â£200 less than August 2006 at a different hotel) via my local travel agent. Would I stay there again? At that price, probably.

Reviews.Title: “scruffy and cramped”
Reviews.Author: minky11
Reviews.Content: the room in this hotel was scruffy and cramped. it is claimed that the hotel was upgraded in about 1999 so i hate to think what the rooms were like then! we had a double room overlooking the gardens (nice view) but there was hardly room to swing a cat (or should that be kitten?). we had a small en-suite, a fridge but no drink making facilities. staff were very friendly and the buffet breakfast adequate. the only saving grace for this hotel is its location directly behind the palace in dam square, only two minutes walk. i would not have minded so much but the room was not that cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Di Ann~Perfect Location~Cute Cat~Tidy Room”
Reviews.Author: jerlenjosaut
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were at the Hotel Di Ann this weekend and had a very pleasant stay. The infamous stairs were there and are very steep, not wheel chair or stroller friendly as there is no elevator. But we had no problems and the staff offer all the help you need. The hotel staff was very friendly and the cat is just too cute & very friendly! We had a room with a balcony (awesome views). The batthroom and room itself was satisfactory, both were clean and cozy. The room is a little small but has enough room....we didnt go to Amsterdam to hang out in our room the whole time. We needed a safe, clean & comfortable place to sleep and shower. The hotel is super close to resturants, shopping, coffee shops, places of interest and bars...Ann Frank House right around the corner. All in All, I WOULD DEFINATELY STAY AGAIN...THANKS TO THE HOTEL AND STAFF FOR A PLEASANT STAY! Lena~ United States

Reviews.Title: “More a hostel than a hotel”
Reviews.Author: fred801
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only suitable for the non fussy traveller looking for a bed for a couple of nights. It's location is ideal but the block is shabby. On arrival we were given the key to a room that was already occupied, the staff barely spoke to us while they sorted out the problem. The bathroom in our room was large and clean, but the room was tiny and very very basic, the curtains were covered in hairs! The breakfast was yuck. Stale cornflakes, warm milk, slices of processed cheese and very hard boiled eggs. There was a toaster to toast the cheappo sliced bread but it only toasted one side. I am not at all fussy but wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone. More like a hostel than a hotel which would be fine if it was hostel priced.

Reviews.Title: “Gives Dutch hotels a bad name”
Reviews.Author: KnaveSharpener
Reviews.Content: First impressions weren't encouraging: a narrow doorway, with a speaker grille and a push button. I pushed it; the door unlocked without a word from the speaker. Now, Holland isn't known for its hills. Allow me to introduce you to the first one I've met in Amsterdam. A very steep flight of very small steps, with radiused turns rather than flat landings, giving extremely small treads when going round the corners. No help getting luggage (thankfully only a heavy-ish carry-on) up them. I was breathing heavily when I got to Reception on the first floor. I've never before, in any hotel in several decades of travel, been asked for a deposit for a TV remote control! US$20, 20euro or 20 pounds Sterling gone from the spending money already. The desk clerk wasn't quite surly, but wasn't the soul of friendliness either, and his English was only slightly better than my Dutch. My room was on floor 4. Joy. More steep steps; lots of them. My luggage and I sighed, and reconciled ourselves to a trek. Having scaled the North Face of the Di Ann, I discovered one of the hotel's more unique features: a fitted cat - calico, pretty and extremely friendly. She immediately adopted me, and followed me - led me, more accurately - into my room. Suits me, I like cats, but anyone who's allergic might want to give the place a miss. *Cough*. The room stunk of smoke, absolutely reeked of it. Ominously, that was with the window open. I wasn't looking forward to closing it. No, wait, I was - the tram noise from downstairs wasn't encouraging. So I closed it. The noise dropped from unbearable to annoying. I always travel with ear-plugs. This is one of the many times I've blessed that particular bit of foresight. I don't want to think what the noise level would be like on the lowest accommodation floor. I understand the need to preserve an external historic appearance, but would secondary double-glazing really break the bank? Decor was Seventies-vintage wood half-panelling, in a shade of drab. The room lighting was weak, giving it a very gloomy appearance. There's no bedside room-lighting switch, or bedside lamp, so expect to get up again just when you're ready to doze off. The bed was comfortable enough, and appeared clean, although the red stains on the sheets suggested they'd been washed with the blankets once too often. Taking a brief lie-down acquainted me with another decorative feature of the room: the false ceiling, fitted with broken and badly-stained tiles. There were no tea or coffee facilities in the room, nor hair-drying, ironing, nor ... well, you get the picture. The one concession to guest comfort was an in-room fridge that looked as if it had also survived the stairs journey, taking the quick route down more than once. The wardrobe contained an electronic safe, which was locked. I couldn't be bothered to ask for it to be opened; I didn't have a laptop with me, and carried my valuables instead. Given the number of staff in any hotel that can open these safes, I don't consider them secure. Stories in other reviews here suggest I was right to be cautious. To the bathroom, as nature couldn't be denied after a long journey. It's a wet-room, with only a shower, no bath. I'll live. The toilet, though ... only a few inches from the front of the seat to the wall. Anyone with long legs (I'm a whisker over 6ft) or, shall we say, a slightly portly figure will have to sit sideways. Mind you, if they're that overweight, full marks for making it up to floor 4 without medical assistance! Time to turn in. And so to breakfast, the following morning. I've stayed in many Dutch hotels, so I know what to expect at breakfast: a variety of breads and cheeses, maybe croissants; meats; fruit; cereals - you get the picture. Di Ann was a little basic. One (white) bread, toasters that can only burn one side at a time, a few tired-looking and sweating slices of cheap gouda, one cereal - corn-flakes - and some hard-boiled eggs. No fruit, no meat - not that I eat meat - but plenty of overloud music video on the large wall screens. All of this in stark contrast to a well-decorated, nicely-appointed breakfast room. Strange. Back to the room, to freshen up for the new day. I'll say this for the shower: it may be gloomy in there, but the shower delivers lots of hot water at a decent pressure, even on the top floor. The cost of all of this was about GBP 120 (around US$240, or EUR 175 at time of writing) per night. In my opinion, this is very poor value for money. Another reviewer has described Di Ann as being like an overpriced travellers' hostel with pretentions, and I have to agree. I'd only come back if I had run out of options. To be honest, if they fitted the benches in Vondelpark with decently secure safes, and the weather was good enough... Anyone wanting a romantic weekend, who has children, who's allergic to cats, whose money:sense ratio's properly calibrated, etc., you might want to try somewhere else. "Might"? What am I saying?

Reviews.Title: “Basic but Fine”
Reviews.Author: bondbug
Reviews.Content: The hotel is basic and the rooms are small ( well it is a town house). We were lucky, we had a balcony which made the stay ok. The breakfast could do with a choice of cereal, cornflakes are a bit boring after a few days. Tea/coffee tray was free but you had to ask for it. If you just want somewhere for B & B to explore the city it's a good place to stay. within easy reach of all the attractions but far anough away from the tourist centre to get a good sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Please stay away, onless you are a 20something!”
Reviews.Author: jazzocat
Reviews.Content: Do not believe the photos, there really isn't much beyond the outer architectural details of the building and the cute calico cat that offer any charm at the Hotel Di-Ann. In Holland, one of the lands of great cheeses, a processed cheese food is served at "breakfast"! The bathroom has such a slow shower drain that the entire room floods even for the swiftest of bathers. Any request is met with a smile and a shake of the head, but don't hold your breath, and don't thnk you won't be repeating that same request. They could do a few, easy things, and have a cleaner, more pleasant establishment. They have a good central location--the rest can and should be fixed!

Reviews.Title: “I was pleased”
Reviews.Author: rustybodog
Reviews.Content: My niece, her husband, and I spent 6 nights at Hotel Di-Ann and we enjoyed it alot. The stairs are indeed steep, but the staff carried my luggage upstairs for me. THANK YOU!!! We stayed in room 410, which overlooks the main street and the canal, so we had a window on each side and enjoyed the view down towards Koninklijk Palais and Dam Square, and also the view towards Westerkerk and the Ann Frank House. As far as breakfast, it was ample and fresh. The hotel cat was delightful and slept with me during a nap. Everyone was polite and helpful. The central location of the hotel beats out any complaints I could have possibly found. We chose the Schippol Connexxion shuttle from the airport which runs about 19 Euro round trip; can't beat that. There is a great restaurant right below the hotel on the corner (screaming lasagna; to die for). It's only a 10 minute walk to the train station, and trams and busses run right in front of the hotel. There is a canal taxi just 2 streets over, and a grocery store on the next block, across from the Westerkerk. Every museum was a nice walk away. I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “No thanks”
Reviews.Author: A_daamDenmark
Reviews.Content: Don't like this hotel. Unfriendly staff, really messy room and halls. We had to ask for a rag to clean the room, because the staff didn't wipe it. They hadn't cleaned it for our arrival either. I wanted to ask for a vacuum cleaner aswell. We asked for the towels ourselves. Full of dust - the bedspread had old stains on it for example. The breakfast wasn't tasty - low budget food. Hard to sleep because of the refrigerator in the room- really noisy. One of the staff was friendly. He came with coffee facilities. The cat was cute also. And the location is good. There's so many other hotels in amsterdam, so next time we will book in another place.

Reviews.Title: “the place to stay in Torteguero”
Reviews.Author: anna064
Reviews.Content: What can i say? this hotel is the best place to stay in the whole of Amsterdam, the location was first class couldn't do better the people in the hotel were lovely, rooms were fine clean and tidy the main thing i look for. breakfast was nice too. We got a room with a balcony which overlooked the canal it was stunning - very romantic only had to look down the road and you could see the royal palace. Overall i found Amsterdam fantastic everything is go all the time and the amount of bicycles in Amsterdam- well it must put bejing to shame! they are everywhere they even got parking tickets for their bikes when they parked them up against lamp posts! it's a different way of life and very enjoyable place to visit any time of the year we went in november and i was very surprised at how warm it was. if you go you should definitely stay at the di ann highly reccomend it!!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jenyfur
Reviews.Content: we (two girls) stayed for two nights at the hotel di-ann, first impressions were the stairs!!! we needed help to get the cases up them!!! they are very steep and wind at the top! Second impression was the size of the room - you couldnt of had a guest to stay with you as there wouldnt be enough air to go round! no cat swinging here! We booked the hotel for its location - which is excellent, you can walk everywhere as you are not far from Dam Square. Breakfast was dissapointing - toast or cornflakes. But an excellent and hot shower made up for this! Staff are friendly and helpful. All in all we felt this was a good choice of hotel for value and its location.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: holi87
Reviews.Content: the di ann is only about a 10 min walk from the train station, but there are many trams that go right past the station and will drop right outside, when we arrived nothing will pre-pare you for the stairs but this is traditional in these old buildings! when we reached the reception the staff where very happy and inviting, we checked in, (note: 20 euro is to be paid on arrival which is given back to you at the end of your stay, this is a deposit for your room key and remote control for you tv in room) the lady at reception gave us some guides to amsterdam and also a map which came in really handy!! :) the staff there also offered to carry our bags to our room for us. When we arrived in our room, we where pleasently surprised by how clean and bright it was, we had a lovely balcony which over looked the canal and the streets outside with french doors opening in wards, although the room was a little small it had everything we needed and the bath room was very clean with fresh towels and soap everyday!! we really enjoyed our stay at the Di Ann hotel, and the cleaning staff where exceptional with the room sparkling clean every evening when we returned, with fresh bed linen. We have never stayed in a 2 star hotel before, always choosing to stay in at least a 4 star, but i would definatly recomend this hotel to anyone and we will definatly be going back again :) the location was fantastic the people where so friendly and we really had a fantastic time. tips: if your looking for local places to eat and little shops to buy provisions i would recomend the italian on the corner, which makes fantastic pizzas, also the little shop next door which has really frienly staff and about anything you want! these are all to the right of the Di Ann when come out the door.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: temper
Reviews.Content: We booked through winter sunshine holidays and it was unclear whether we had booked a twin or double room? tried contacting winter sunshine in Derby but they already had our money and two separate people were quite unhelpful (won't use them again), they said they would put a request in for a double room but the email wouldn't be confirmed as received and they said they didn't even have the number of the hotel for us to call ourselves, I found it myself off the net and they said a twin should be no problem and sure enough reception sorted it. The hotel is a 15 minute walk from the main train station and is just behind Dam square, perfectly located for everything, we had to climb three flights of steep stairs but for the able bodied no problem. Room was tiny, small soft beds, some views but difficult to gain a perspective (although some rooms are bigger with balcony), bathroom nearly as large as our room and a really powerful shower which is good. The room was clean and tidy, cleaned daily and there is a hotel cat!!! its an old building so you can't expect all mod cons, the fire alarm light wasn't on so not sure if it worked? semi-quiet location next to busy road and tram route but not too bad, great email facility, great dining room with large T.V., very friendly staff, Egyptian run, make sure you remember the 20 euro deposit on departure and try the Iraqi run Italian next door for some fine Pizza or Pasta. This is Amsterdam and there were a few monged out people but they do seem hot on who they allow into the rooms which is reassuring.. on the whole, its a good budget two star hotel. I would consider returning for a few days city break again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it - Extremely tiny rooms, dirty and expensive”
Reviews.Author: sea-TRIP
Reviews.Content: Dirty toilet, the blanket sheet was used (!!) and full with unknown stains. We asked to change it with a clean one and we got an answer that they will change it only during the morning. The guy at the reception desk was smoking all night long and the smoke got straight to our room. The room was more liks a solitary confinement. We paid 140 euro per night. We left after one night and stayd for one night at the NH Doelen (4 stars hotel!) for 94 euro per night and two nights at the NH Tropen (3 stars hotel) for 56 euro per night - two excellent hotles.

Reviews.Title: “good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Ronale
Reviews.Content: We booked a deluxe room with a balcony and you still could not swing a cat it was so small, however it was still a great value, clean and comfortable budget B&B. On the positive side the beds were very comfortable, the view of the canal was nice. Breakfast, although very basic was a great start to the day. The staff and the cat were very friendly. The location was great, we did not have to catch transport anywhere. On the down side, nothing on this earth will prepare you for the stairs!!! I had read many reviews all noting the steep stairs, but when you arrive and see them your mouth will drop in shock. it is obviously a trademark of many B&Bs in Amsterdam and not exclusive to this hotel. our deluxe room was on the 1st floor so we were lucky to only have to climb the first set. if you are fit and healthy, it only presents a problem when transporting your suitcases. be careful if you book a smoking room like we did as when we entered our room till we left 2 days after, the room and our clothes stank of cannabis from the previous occupants. This may or may not bother you (depending on your purpose of visiting), but it is worth knowing. Overall. a great spot to stay with a friend for a couple of days. I would definitely stay again although if i was traveling for romance purposes i would probably spend a bit more and go for something more up market.

Reviews.Title: “Great View from Room”
Reviews.Author: pupdud
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel for the price. The stairs were steep, but most of them are in Europe. We had a corner room with large windows with great views of the river and the streets. The downtown area was just a few blocks away. The bathroom had a plain floor that was also the bottom of the shower, but I have seen worse. Everyone was nice and internet was reasonable. They also had a housecat that was entertaining.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, good location, ok breakfast, overpriced”
Reviews.Author: bigphil1
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews on all the sites but was still surprised (and dissapointed) on the size of the room, it is obviously a normal sized room split into two. However, it is quite clean with a change of towels each day and the location is very good. Breakfast is toast, hard boiled eggs, coffee and orange juice and as much of it as you want. The stairs weren't as steep as I thought they would be. I thought that for 270Euros for three days I might have got a bit better for my money???

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: pinkstripe
Reviews.Content: After reading some positive reviews on here about the Di-ann hotel i decided to go ahead and book it for my fellas 30th. It was exactly what i expected. Our room was however a little bit too small but it was one of the smallest as it was right at the top with two tiny windows but i think this is managable, especially for a weekend break. The bed was not the most comfy bed i had slept in but again it did the job. It was actually two single beds pushed together and it was rather small but i was happy with it and i think most peple would be the same. The bathroom was spot on. The shower was so powerful and we were offered clean towels, toilet roll and soap every morning. Their were no drinks facilities in the rooms but somewhere it stated that these were avalible upon request which is fair enougth really! Breakfast was fine, toast, cheese, cereal and boiled eggs and always enougth to go around the breakfast time wasnt to bad either 7 till half 10.....so still time for a sleep in heh! The housekeeping guys were always hard at work and the rooms were cleaned everymorning. Ours wasnt as we were always in it (late nights!!) The locatation is the best thing about this hotel, and Amsterdam is the most beautiful city. The staff are really helpful. I did pay a little to much for this hotel....i think i prolly should have had a deluxe room instead of the smallest of the small but i still had an awesome time! P.S The stairs really are that bad!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: noecat5
Reviews.Content: 3 adults stayed 2 nights in a triple room in late September 2006. The location is great for people who wish to walk because everything is within walking distance. We went to the Heineken Experience, the Anne Frank House, the Pancake Bakery, The Hard Rock Cafe, and all over the central city and enjoyed walking. There are trams all over to use if you need to but we liked walking. We stayed out of the bike lanes and we were fine. The hotel is above other stores so there is a narrow stairway to the hotel lobby which was not easy with our luggage. The room was very very tiny with 3 twin beds, but we had a little fridge and tv and a balcony which was so nice and the view was wonderful! Also in their breakfast area they offer free internet access - we had our own laptop and it was free. They also have 2 computers there, I'm not sure if those would have been free or not. The breakfast was very good. They have a cat there who is very sweet and friendly! A calico named Kiko. i enjoyed the cat since I missed my pets at home. The hotel staff were all very helpful and friendly too.

Reviews.Title: “great value for money”
Reviews.Author: fran15111
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 2 nights,very good location and payed 60euros with breakfast. Hotel is basic but clean and very friendly and helpful staff. Rooms are small,old but comfortable. Would recommend this hotel. Only one thing as in a lot of hotels in Amsterdam to enter you must walk up a very very steep set of stairs. Could be a problem if your an elderly traveller especially with a suitcase.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ChrsChmbrln
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with an excellent location on the corner of Herrengracht. Dam Square is only a five minute walk away, (if you manage to avoid getting killed by a tram or a cyclist!), and we managed to walk to all the major attractions (e.g. Rijks Museum) in under half an hour. That is a pleasant stroll along the canals. The Red Light district with its many bars and clubs is within a 15 minute walk, though the hotel is in a pleasant and safe part of town. The room was a bit basic but no real complaints, and the stairs up to the hotel from the street were a bit steep, but there again that's quite common in Amsterdam. Breakfast was self service - bread, toast, cheese, eggs, coffee, tea, juice etc. and plenty of it! The best bit? Kiku the friendly hotel cat. Bet she's forgotten us already!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: gregnjeanie
Reviews.Content: We just got back from staying 2 nights at the Di-Ann hotel. We thought the location was great. It was really close to the Anne Frank house, the Homomonument and the Dam Center which is central to the trams. You could use the internet for 3 Euro an hour which was cheap. The breakfast was toast, eggs, juice, coffee and cereal. Nothing too big, but enough to get you started. They need another toaster as that was the biggest wait for breakfast. The area is clean but can be really crowded depending on when you eat. The room was for 2 adults and 2 children. It was 4 twin beds with a TV and mini frig on the 4th floor. It was quiet at night which was good. The beds were comfortable and clean. The TV has a lot of English stations. The price for us was 160 Euro. A good price when I was comparing hotels. It definitely wasn't anythng fancy but it was good for our trip. We asked for a fan and they let us use a small one for the room. We wanted this mostly for background noise, not because it was hot. The people were helpful and would answer any questions. The stairs are VERY Steep like everyone said but easy if you don't have any problems walking. The kids thought they were fun. I felt safe at the hotel. They had a buzzer with someone there 24 hours to let you in so I thought that was good. I would stay there again if we went back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: pakehagirl
Reviews.Content: We booked a triple room for myself, a friend, and my 6 yr old son, upstairs on the fourth floor, for 3 nights, from May 22 to 25. I had previously read all the moaning comments about the steep stairs, but we made a joke of them...it was like climbing Mt Everest every day, after a full day of sight-seeing. All we could do was laugh about them, and being very fit, found them no problem, even carrying our luggage up and down them. We enjoyed our stay at the hotel and found it very central to Amsterdam, for sight-seeing. The Bike shop was close by, to hire bikes, and the central train station was only a short walk as well. We found the staff very friendly; the room was clean; the cat was friendly; and the breakfast basic. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, shame about the stairs!”
Reviews.Author: Bryoney
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Di-ann for 2 nights from 3-5 June 06, and could not have asked for a better base for exploring Amsterdam. The hotel is bang in the centre of town, a short walk from the museums, red light district, dam square and central station, but tucked out of the way of the 'fruitier' side of the city. The staff were incredibly friendly, they speak very good English, and are always willing to help with directions- they were even friendly when we locked our key in the room. The rooms are basic and quite small, but are clean, have a free fridge and safe, and offer great views, we could see the palace, magna plaza, canal, and Westerkerk from our room! We were at the front of the hotel, and there was some road noise, but i'm a light sleeper and had no probs with the noise. The complimentary breakfast is basic but fits the bill, and there is a supermarket next to the hotel that sells plenty of beer, wine and food. The only down side is definately the stairs, we had read other reviews saying how steep they were but the warnings didnt prepare us for the near vertical staircase we found! Theres no denying these are steep stairs, there is no lift and our room was on the 4th floor. If you have mobility problems you really should give this hotel a miss, but everyone else should not let a few stairs put them off what is otherwise a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: jeffcavalier
Reviews.Content: Hi My son and I stayed here from 24th of May 2006 for three nights. The stairs were very steep making it not suitable for elderley, the room was very small (room 302) the sink needs a new style tap its hard to wash without banging you face on it the breakfast was basic eggs, toast, cheese , cerial , but the staff were friendly and the room was clean and cleaned each day although there was a few complaints , all in all the hotel was o.k and I would stay again . close to center, but out of the way of the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Vicky528
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location. It was easy to get to all the attractions on foot. We enjoyed the balcony to watch the city while slowing down a little. You can hear the church bells ring well from here also. The stairs are steep and the room we had was VERY SMALL, but the price was good. My complaint is that we were charged 25 euro as a deposit on the room key, which is highly unusual. We were told we would get this back when we checked out, however, we forgot and the staff neglected to bring up the issue, so we paid an extra 25 euro. It seemed like a cheap trick in a city where many tourist might be distracted by the time they check out. .

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: macz
Reviews.Content: went to amsterdam for a couple of days in feb 2006, this hotel has a great location 5mins from anne franks house and 5mins from dam square. the staff are very helpful gave us a free map and all speak english very well. we had a great view from balcony. the room was very clean and there was a kettle with coffee and tea. the steps are very steep to rooms so you have to be careful, the breakfast is ok but if you want a cooked breafast theres plenty of reasonable priced cafes. we will definately be going back to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “would recomend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: olivia14
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from this hotel i would go back it was very clean staff friendly breakfast was good but watch the toaster we had cornflake fresh bread orange juice tea coffee jam eggs cheese plenty to fill you up for the day. I WOULD GO BACK WHEN I VISIT AMSTERDAM AGAIN THE STAIRS WERE STEEP BUT IF YOU FIT NO PROBLEM

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lfcmad2002
Reviews.Content: Great location 10 min walk from central station 5 min walk from Red Light Very clean rooms with very clean standards Very friendly staff Internet at a small cost Ace breakfast Stairs a pretty steep,so no use for eldery or disabled

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hi, i visited the hotel Di anne for two nights, with some of the lads, it has a very central location for the popular attractions such as the Dam square, Red light and in the other direction some fun bars and great clubs! I found the staff very helpful & spoke english well. The rooms are small and the en-suite very tight but if your worried about that sort of thing you should expect like anywhere to pay more. (and plus on holiday why would you wonna stay in your hotel for to long! lol) the hotel in general in clean and does what it said on the tin. a great budget2 star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: taraship
Reviews.Content: Ok, yes the stairs are steep but if you know the history of Amsterdam, you know why they are steep. (Taxes were based on width of home so most older buildings are very tall and not very wide, thus creating stairs that don't take a lot of space). I thought the people were extremely friendly and they carried my luggage up the steep steps. We even managed a visit from the hotel cat, who is quite sweet and loving. I stayed for 5 nights and was quite happy. Incredible location...close to everything. It is extremely noisy facing the street so ask for a rear room, if available. Otherwise, make sure you buy ear plugs. Breakfast was more than adequate but beware of the toasters. Clean and tidy but again, you get what you pay for. If you want 3 or 4 star style for the price you pay here, you will surely be disappointed. I would stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fine at the Di - Ann”
Reviews.Author: barry_432
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews of lots of Hotels in Amsterdam I settled on the Di- Ann as I was going to Amsterdam to run in the Half Marathon and wanted a safe and secure and reasonably priced base. The staff were very friendly and welcoming giving me a map on arrival and the hotel clean. When I needed advice about directions they were pleased to help. Yes the stairs are steep but so what - free exercise thrown in and not untypical for the city. My room a superior single was small but had a balcony and ensuite. TV included French & German stations as well as BBC1 & BBC2 (you have to give a 20EUR deposit for the remote). Breakfast is as described - cereal, coffee, tea and toast with a variety of jams, cheese or egg). It was fine. I paid 143EUR for 2 nights on apopular weekend - I thought it was reasonable value for this city and a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Great ,but stairs very bad after a few”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Staff friendly and most helpful,breakfast average for hotel of this standard.Stairs to recepition steep and after a night out would be a bit of a handful. Would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “never again!! what a dump!!”
Reviews.Author: reiki-angel-del
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel for 2 nights, the stairs were steep as people have been saying, the staff were unfriendly at reception. breakfast very basic(boiled egg, cereal,tea,coffee,juice,bread,cheese,jam. help your self job and not much of it put out!)the room was small as reviews, bathroom was small and looked dirty. was promised hairdryer in room and tea/coffee making facilities but zilch. we arranged an early breakfast for the day we left but got up to breakfast room and was served nothing(no staff was awake, the receptionist didnt speak english). on arrival we had to give 20 euros for tv control which we got back)..we got covered in either mossie bites or flea bites too. this is the worst hotel i've ever stayed in. the only good side of things was the complimentary sweets at reception!!!!....the room cost Â£80 a night and was the pits!!!!...think twice before you book here!!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Di-Ann
HotelInfo.Address: Raadhuisstraat 27, Amsterdam 1016 DC, The Netherlands
